creator: kevin.wilson@comtrol.com
text:
Something in SuSE 9.1 changed so now the su command doesn't properly work 
unless you specify the shell using "-s /bin/bash" (or whatever shell you use). 
So older su commands like: 
 
"su myuser -c mycommand" had to change to  
"su -s myshell -c mycommand - myuser"  
 
The information from this link: 
 
http://ftp.lug.ro/suse/projects/apache/jakarta-tomcat/8.1-i386/jakarta-tomcat.changes 
 
gave me a clue as to why my script would not work when using the su command.

This is not a Tomcat bug, it's not even related to Tomcat, it's a general su on 
SuSe issue.
creator: yoavs@computer.org
kevin.wilson@comtrol.com
text:
I am aware of that once I found the solution but since SuSE uses the wwwrun user
by default when Tomcat is not installed from CD and a older script to start
Tomcat is deployed the default shell change may seem like a Tomcat issue. That
is why I posted this, to prevent more like it.
